Grouped_Utterances: Hi, Ellie. I’ve been okay. I finally sent that message to my family.
I’ve been reflecting a lot on my last relationship and how it ended. I still feel a lot of guilt about it. I feel like I let her down and that I could have done more to make things work.

It was a relief, but I’m also really anxious about their response. Not yet. I’m trying to stay patient, but it’s hard. I’ve been exploring the themes of connection and isolation in my novel. It feels relevant to what I’m experiencing. It’s cathartic, but sometimes it makes me feel more vulnerable. I’ve applied to a few more jobs and followed up with some contacts. No responses yet, though. I’m feeling a bit defeated. It’s hard not to take the lack of responses personally.
I think my mental health issues played a big role. I wasn’t in a good place, and I didn’t communicate that well.
I’m not sure. I want to, but I worry about repeating the same mistakes.

I’ve been keeping busy with writing and doing my mindfulness exercises.  I try to remind myself that it’s part of the process and that it’s okay to feel uncomfortable. I haven’t, but that could be a good way to gain experience and keep my skills sharp.

I think I’ll look into it. It might take some pressure off the job search too. I guess I need to be more open about my struggles in future relationships.  Yeah, that makes sense. I need to work on being comfortable with myself first. I think that covers it for now. I just want to keep moving forward.
